meanings.definition: In a divided or contrasting manner
meanings.sent1: The siblings argued dichotomously about their favorite colors.
meanings.sent2: The colors of the flag were arranged dichotomously, with red on one side and blue on the other.
meanings.sent3: The cat and dog stared at each other dichotomously, unsure whether to fight or play.
meanings.sent4: The opinions on the matter were dichotomously split, like two opposing forces.
meanings.sent5: The forest was dichotomously silent, with one side bustling with life and the other eerily quiet.

meanings.definition: Divided into two parts or classifications
meanings.sent1: The dichotomously colored butterfly fluttered gracefully in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The dichotomously structured organization had clear divisions in its hierarchy.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomously designed room had one half modern and the other traditional.
meanings.sent4: The dichotomously marked path led hikers to two distinct landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomously labeled boxes made it easy to separate the items into two categories.
